repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

comment_data.body: retval_cname really should be null here I think
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -10538,41 +10538,46 @@ def yield_from_func(self, code):
     def generate_evaluation_code(self, code, source_cname=None, decref_source=False):
         if source_cname is None:
             self.arg.generate_evaluation_code(code)
-        code.putln("%s = %s(%s, %s);" % (
-            Naming.retval_cname,
+        result_temp = code.funcstate.allocate_temp(PyrexTypes.PySendResult_type, manage_ref=False)
+        code.putln("%s = %s(%s, %s, &%s);" % (
+            result_temp,
             self.yield_from_func(code),
             Naming.generator_cname,
-            self.arg.py_result() if source_cname is None else source_cname))
+            self.arg.py_result() if source_cname is None else source_cname,
+            Naming.retval_cname))
+
         if source_cname is None:
             self.arg.generate_disposal_code(code)
             self.arg.free_temps(code)
         elif decref_source:
             code.put_decref_clear(source_cname, py_object_type)
-        code.put_xgotref(Naming.retval_cname, py_object_type)
 
-        code.putln("if (likely(%s)) {" % Naming.retval_cname)
+        code.putln("if (likely(%s == PYGEN_NEXT)) {" % result_temp)
+        code.put_gotref(Naming.retval_cname, py_object_type)
+        code.funcstate.release_temp(result_temp)  # before generating the yield code
         self.generate_yield_code(code)
-        code.putln("} else {")
-        # either error or sub-generator has normally terminated: return value => node result
+        code.putln("} else if (likely(%s == PYGEN_RETURN)) {" % result_temp)
+        code.put_gotref(Naming.retval_cname, py_object_type)
         if self.result_is_used:
             self.fetch_iteration_result(code)
         else:
-            self.handle_iteration_exception(code)
+            code.put_decref_clear(Naming.retval_cname, py_object_type)
+        code.putln("} else {")
+        self.propagate_exception(code)
         code.putln("}")
 
-    def fetch_iteration_result(self, code):
+    def propagate_exception(self, code):
         # YieldExprNode has allocated the result temp for us
-        code.putln("%s = NULL;" % self.result())
-        code.put_error_if_neg(self.pos, "__Pyx_PyGen_FetchStopIterationValue(&%s)" % self.result())
-        self.generate_gotref(code)
+        code.put_xgotref(Naming.retval_cname, py_object_type)

comment_data.body: Not for this PR, but I believe that `is_running` needs to be handled a little more carefully in a free-threading world.

Would be good if this could work/at least not break compilation with Limited API

I think it's fine for 3.10+ (we can just get it with the normal slot mechanism) but below that we doing have access to `__Pyx_PyAsyncMethodsStruct` (so it just has to be skipped).
Probably `LIMITED_VERSION_HEX` I think, since we're not going to be able to retrieve `am_send` on limited API versions below that.
It's possible I've missed something, but I don't think any of the callers use `retval` so it feels like an complication to return it.
Right. I think a `TryGetSlot()` protected by `! LIMITED || LIMITED_VERSION_HEX >= 3.10` should make this work (or disable it) in both settings.
Hmm. We don't _need_ these special cases if we use `am_send`. So, if we can't use `am_send` in Limited API < 3.10, then you're right, it would be better to have them. I'll change it.

commit.message:
Refactor coroutines to make use of "am_send" (new in Py3.10 and backported).
See https://bugs.python.org/issue42085
Disable async slot usage in Py3.4 since the tests fail and this needs a bit more backporting, for not much benefit.
Avoid C compiler warning about unused C function when async slots are not enabled.
Fix reference leak for None in aiter return case.
"Py_TPFLAGS_HAVE_AM_SEND" was removed before finally releasing Py3.10, so we only need it for the backport in older versions to detect that a coroutine has the field.

commit.message: Fix several issues with StopIteration handling and the way status return ints are translated back into Python method returns.
Support 'am_send' in the Limited C-API by checking for the 'Py_am_send' slot.
Fix compilation by switching to newly added helper function (merge relict).
Remove CYTHON_USE_ASYNC_SLOTS feature flag which was only really relevant before Py3.5.
Clean up some exception helper declarations and distinguish the builtin Exception type from the builtin BaseException type.
Release temps earlier on generator exceptions.
Discard special  yield-from cases only if we can actually use "am_send" instead, and keep them in pre-Py3.10 Limited API settings.

title: Refactor coroutines to make use of "am_send" (new in Py3.10 and backported)
